subject: RE: [junit] JUNITas Ant-Task in Eclipse 2.1

I am running ant in WSAD 5.0 (based on eclipse 2.0).

I think the problem m=
ay be that junit.jar is not in the ant build path.
Look at prefrences exter=
nal tools and add junit.jar to the ant class path
and see if that helps.

L=
et me know if I can be of more help.

Randy

Subject: [junit] JUNITas Ant-Task in Eclipse 2.1


Servus,

does anyone ha=
s some experiences in using JUNIT in conjunction with ant
and eclipse 2.1?
=

I tried to run my tests in many different ways and I have seen many
differ=
ent error-messages, but never got the expected results=E2=98=B9


That's th=
e ant-target:

 <target name=3D"test" depends=3D"compile">

	<junit printsu=
mmary=3D"yes" haltonfailure=3D"no" fork=3D"yes">
      <classpath>
	       =
 <fileset dir=3D"${libdir.src}">
	          <include name=3D"**/*.jar"/>
	 =
       </fileset>
           <pathelement path=3D"${classes.target}"/>
    =
  </classpath>
  	  <formatter type=3D"xml" usefile=3D"yes"/>
	  <test name=
=3D"biz.beaglesoft.rb.gmw.network.TestAllTests"
todir=3D"./web" outfile=3D"=
result">
	  </test>
	</junit>

  </target>



In the ${libdir.src} there is=
 a junit.jar that holds the class
junit/framework/TestListener. This junit.=
jar is also added to the
[window.preferences.externaltools.ant]-ClasspathDi=
alog. But
nethertheless I got the following exception:

java.lang.NoClassDe=
fFoundError: junit/framework/TestListener
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineC=
lass0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java=
:493)
	at
java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.jav=
a:111)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:248)
	at=
 java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56)

If I delete th=
is junit.jar-entry from that Ant-dialog I get the
following error-message:
=
BUILD FAILED: E:\Develop\gmwproto4test\build\build.xml:157: Could not
creat=
e task of type: junit. Common solutions are to use taskdef to
declare your =
task, or, if this is an optional task, to put the
optional.jar in the lib d=
irectory of your ant installation (ANT_HOME).

I think it should be possibl=
e to get junit running under eclipse from
within ant, so please, could anyb=
ody give me a hint?

Have a nice and peacefully day

Wolfgang
